reviewText: These two video's are absoulutely wonderful.  The production and the acting ability of the people involved, just ordinary people, not professionals, is amazing.  The story lines are great entertainment for the whole family, wholesome with a great message.  You cannot help but be so touched.  These are video's that you will watch over and over again.
Title: Facing the Giants / Flywheel Director's Cut  Two-Pack

reviewText: Two more totally remarkable DVDS.We plan are sharing them with our married children.Keep up the great work and please continue in the christian video market.Carol Freitag, Mayville WI
Title: Facing the Giants / Flywheel Director's Cut  Two-Pack

reviewText: I was so glad to find flywheel on your website. I have the last one from this same publisher "Fireproof" and wanted the whole set. Great salesmanship. Thanks A+++++++++++++
Title: Facing the Giants / Flywheel Director's Cut  Two-Pack

reviewText: Two outstanding pictures with a moral message.  This set contains the films "FACING THE GIANTS" & "FLYWHEEL" created by the people behind the current outstanding theater HIT, "FIREPROOF."  I wholeheartedly recommend all three movies to everyone, including my own children and their families.You will see some of the same "stars" performing different roles in each of these stories.  This Georgia movie-making congregation is cranking out quality without Hollywood.  While you're waiting on the release of "Fireproof" on DVD, get this set and enjoy both.  Don't let the NOT RATED scare you.  No one swears, kills, is nude, or any of the other "suggested musts" of the traditional movie producers.  This is good, funny, inspirational, touching, spiritual, joyful...well...it's all good.AWESOME job by Sherwood Pictures and the writing, producing, directing, and acting of the Kendrick brothers.  There is even lots of good special feature extras showing how they do it in Georgia.
summary: FAMILY CHRISTIAN ENTERTAINMENT FOR ANY AGE
Title: Facing the Giants / Flywheel Director's Cut  Two-Pack

reviewText: In "Flywheel", a car salesman listens to his wife (smart man!) and puts God first in his life, runnning his business with honesty and integrity. He eventually reaps great rewards, both spiritual and financial. The struggles he goes through and the perseverance demonstrated in doing what is right when it seems he is failing, and in the relationships that are built during those times, is inspiring. In "Facing the Giants", a man learns how to be a great football coach, inspires his team and others, and persists in taking the high road even when the odds are against him. What happens between a son (one of the players) and his father is a very poignant resolution of a healed relationship. The only thing I didn't like about this movie was the emphasis on the couple (coach and wife) trying so hard to have a baby. I thought that depicted them as very  irresponsible since they couldn't even afford to fix their car and his job prospects seemed so unstable. I loved the way he talked with his players and colleagues and others, not hiding his faith, but I can't imagine that kind of talking being allowed at a public school without someone complaining about it. If you can ignore the part about the couple being irresponsible and can imagine talk about God and scripture used at a school, you will really enjoy this movie.
Title: Facing the Giants / Flywheel Director's Cut  Two-Pack

reviewText: How privileged we are to be recipients of such great movies as these! Very entertaining with absolutely believable stories.  We will be happy and blessed if more like these are made....and they are!
Title: Facing the Giants / Flywheel Director's Cut  Two-Pack

reviewText: there aren't enough uplifting movies that i feel safe watching with my children.  no profanity, no sexually explicit scenes great moral material that will make their lives better by thinking about it.
Title: Facing the Giants / Flywheel Director's Cut  Two-Pack
